intro: Galium coronatum var. glaberrimum, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly rough texture. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
